summary: This is a November 16, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a production of discovery materials including AT&T records, phone records, and photographs, all subject to a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a batch of discovery materials, including AT&T records, phone records, and photographs, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials including AT&T records, phone records, and photographs to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on November 16, 2021.
All produced materials are subject to a protective order dated July 31, 2020, with specific paragraphs governing confidentiality.

The Department of Justice directed the office to cease using the word 'confidential' on these materials to avoid confusion with classified document markings, leading to a new label referencing the protective order paragraphs.
The document confirms the ongoing discovery obligations of the government in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
